title: About me
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm Ishita Khanna, a data analyst with a focus on creating clear, insightful and impactful data-driven solutions.
I approach data projects with a blend of analytical thinking, attention to detail, and a user focused mindset, Whether it‚Äôs exploring open datasets, designing dashboards, or building end-to-end workflows, I enjoy finding meaningful patterns and communicating results effectively.
This portfolio highlights some of my recent work from the TidyTuesday community and will continue to grow with academic, personal, and applied projects.
I‚Äôm always open to learning new techniques, tools and domains and excited to contribute wherever data can make a difference.

title: Data Analytics Portfolio
text:
I‚Äôm a data analyst with a strong experience in data visualisation, predictive modelling, and interactive dashboards using raw data to drive meaningful decisions across multiple domains.
My toolbox includes:

Languages & Analytics: R, Python, SQL, Excel
Visualisation: ggplot2, Tableau, Power BI, R Shiny, d3.js
Machine Learning: Supervised/Unsupervised learning, predictive modeling
Cloud & Web: Posit Cloud, Shinyapps.io, Quarto, HTML/CSS
Project Tools: GitHub, Trello, Notion




This portfolio currently showcases a growing collection of my Tidy Tuesday projects, where I display my exploratory analysis, data visualisation and dashboarding experience using real world datasets.
I‚Äôll continue to expand it over time with additional projects, including academic work and case studies from various domains.
Explore Projects ‚Üí
Thanks for stopping by!

title: RFDS Network Visualisation
text:
This project investigates the patterns in flight arrivals at RFDS bases across Australia using flight logs from July 2022.
Two core visual explorations are included:

Bar Chart of flight arrivals categorised by time of day (Day vs Night)
Interactive Map of base activity and aircraft operations using Leaflet




We first examine RFDS flights landing at bases in Queensland, grouped by aircraft and arrival timestamps.



Day vs Night Arrivals at selected RFDS Bases



Day: 6 AM - 6 PM, Night: 6 PM - 6 AM





Use the dropdown to explore RFDS base locations and view flight details by aircraft type







GitHub Repository


Analysis performed using R packages: dplyr, ggplot2, leaflet, shiny, lubridate, readr.

title: RFDS Queensland Flight Network using D3.js
text:
This D3.js project explores Royal Flying Doctor Service (RFDS) flight routes and base activity within Queensland, using flight logs from July 2022.
The map highlights:

Red nodes: RFDS bases
Blue node: Brisbane - no incoming or outgoing of flights from this base
Lines: Flight paths
Tooltip: It shows detailed info i.e.¬†no. of arrivals, departures, distances, flight count
Path thickness: Representing amount of trips on that path
Node thickness: Based on traffic at that location/base






GitHub Repository

Analysis performed using D3.js and Javascript and visualisation was built sing SVG elements.

title: Pokemon Stat Dashboard
text: This interactive dashboard visualises Pokemon base stats across generations using the 2025-04-01 TidyTuesday dataset. The dashboard provides insights into stat distribution patterns, standout Pokemon outliers, average stats in generations and allows users to explore individual Pokemon stat profiles.

title: Pokemon Stat Dashboard
text: This interactive dashboard visualises Pokemon base stats across generations using the 2025-04-01 TidyTuesday dataset. The dashboard provides insights into stat distribution patterns, standout Pokemon outliers, average stats in generations and allows users to explore individual Pokemon stat profiles.

title: NSF Grant Terminations Analysis
text:
This interactive Shiny app explores patterns in early terminations of NSF-funded research projects. The analysis focuses on both individual project timelines and geographical trends across U.S. states.
Key questions investigated:

How early do grants typically terminate?
Do certain directorates have more early terminations?
Which states and organizations are affected the most?






How long do NSF projects typically run before termination, and how early are they ended relative to their planned duration?




Built an interactive Gantt chart
Users select a directorate to view its projects
Start = project start date

End = actual termination date

Dotted line = expected end date








Which U.S. states had the highest number of terminated NSF grants?




Created a choropleth heatmap of terminations by state
Users can click on a state to see a bar chart of organizations with terminations










üìÇ View the GitHub repo

üîó See my LinkedIn post

title: Seismic Activity Dashboard
text:
This interactive dashboard explores trends in seismic activity near Mount Vesuvius using data from the 2025-05-13 TidyTuesday dataset.
The dataset records volcanic tremors from 2011 to 2025 and is used here to answer:

üìà Has seismic activity changed in frequency or strength over time?
üåã Are events occurring deeper underground?
üî• How do depth and magnitude correlate?

title: Seismic Activity Dashboard
text:

The dataset records volcanic tremors from 2011 to 2025 and is used here to answer:

üìà Has seismic activity changed in frequency or strength over time?
üåã Are events occurring deeper underground?

title: Seismic Activity Dashboard
text:
Dashboard Features
The app allows dynamic filtering by:

Year Range
Review Status (revised, preliminary, or all)

It includes the following charts:

üìä Seismic Event Timeline ‚Äî Count vs Average Magnitude over time

üéØ Depth Scatterplot ‚Äî How deep earthquakes occur by year

üü® Heatmap by Depth Band ‚Äî Activity concentration across depth zones

title: userR! 2025 Keywords Network
text:
This interactive project explores how keywords were used across sessions at the useR! 2025 conference. The goal was to analyse and visualise how topics clustered together using text mining and network analysis techniques.


This analysis used the following R libraries:

tidyverse for data manipulation
tidytext for splitting keywords and keyword processing
widyr for calculating pairwise keyword co-occurrence
ggraph, igraph, and tidygraph for network visualization
shiny for interactivity

To prepare the data:

The dataset was cleaned by separating comma-separated keywords into individual rows
Extra whitespace and missing values were removed
Session-level keyword groupings were constructed using unite() and pairwise_count()
The final result was a co-occurrence network, where nodes are keywords and edges represent how often they appeared together in a session












Keyword Network





üìÇ View the GitHub repo

üîó See my LinkedIn post
